DOC.detailed_description: Objectives : To evaluate effect integrate treatment patient first episode psychotic illness . Design : Randomised clinical trial . Setting : Copenhagen Hospital Corporation Psychiatric Hospital Aarhus , Denmark Participants : 547 patient first episode schizophrenia spectrum disorder . Interventions : Integrated treatment standard treatment . The integrated treatment last two year consist assertive community treatment programme family involvement social skill train . Standard treatment offer contact community mental health centre . Main outcome measure : Psychotic negative symptom ( score 0 maximum 5 ) one two year ' follow-up . Results : At one year 's follow-up , psychotic symptom change favourably mean 1.09 ( standard deviation 1.27 ) estimate mean difference group -0.31 ( 95 % confidence interval -0.55 -0.07 , P=0.02 ) favour integrate treatment . Negative symptom change favourably estimate difference group -0.36 ( -0.54 -0.17 , P < 0.001 ) favour integrate treatment . At two year ' follow-up estimate mean difference group psychotic symptom -0.32 ( -0.58 -0.06 , P=0.02 ) negative symptom -0.45 ( -0.67 -0.22 , P < 0.001 ) , favour integrated treatment . Patients receive integrated treatment significantly less comorbid substance misuse , good adherence treatment , satisfaction treatment . Conclusion : Integrated treatment improved clinical outcome adherence treatment . The improvement clinical outcome consistent one year two year follow-up .
